metadata.title: CVE-2024-8932 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 8.1.* before 8.1.31, 8.2.* before 8.2.26, 8.3.* before8.3.14, uncontrolled long string inputs to ldap_escape()Â function on 32-bitsystems can cause an integer overflow, resulting in an out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-8932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.26').
